decks.notes: This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, discard effects, and removal spells. The deck aims to maintain control of the board using powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix while constantly disrupting the opponent's resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to further control the game and secure victory. The deck's mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to all needed colors.

The primary focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells like Force of Will, card advantage engines like Accumulated Knowledge and Snapcaster Mage, and board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Terminus. The deck aims to control the board state and grind out incremental advantages through card selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage and manipulation. This deck seeks to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and incremental advantages.

The deck is focused on utilizing Eldrazi creatures and lands to quickly overwhelm the opponent with high power creatures and disruption spells. It aims to play aggressively by utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Grim Monolith and Cloudpost to play out its Eldrazi threats early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Sorcerous Spyglass to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Chalice of the Void to shut down low-cost spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around quickly establishing a board presence and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources by using cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void, while also establishing a recurring loop with Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire. By repeatedly using these cards, the deck aims to grind out the opponent's options and eventually overwhelm them with the value generated from cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant. The deck also includes some utility creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Reclamation Sage to deal with specific threats, making it a versatile and resilient control deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. By combining reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate with powerful creatures, the deck aims to cheat out big threats early in the game and overwhelm the opponent with a combo strategy. Cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask help protect the combo pieces from disruption, while cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal provide additional mana acceleration to execute the combo efficiently.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans while maintaining card advantage and board control. Using a combination of efficient removal spells, disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of countermagic, removal, and card draw, Grixis Control looks to grind out incremental advantages and win through attrition.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize low cost creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. By utilizing cards like Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent and protect your own creatures, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence. Cards like Stoneforge Mystic, Aether Vial, and Recruiter of the Guard help you find and play powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance your creatures and close out games quickly. Efficient land disruption with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland is also key to maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to pressure the opponent with fast, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Hooting Mandrills, Nimble Mongoose, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Stifle, Spell Snare, Spell Pierce, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, and can also draw cards and set up its next plays with Ponder and Brainstorm. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Chandra, Torch of Defiance early in the game while locking down the opponent's mana base with Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon. By disrupting the opponent's ability to cast spells and produce mana, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm them with powerful creatures and burn spells. Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void further hinder the opponent's ability to cast spells, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this UWx Control Legacy deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes powerful hate cards like Back to Basics and Counterbalance to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By manipulating the top of their library with cards such as Predict and Terminus, the player aims to outvalue and outmaneuver their opponent in a slow and methodical manner, ultimately securing victory through overwhelming card advantage and control of the board.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Force of Will to control the game while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up strong draws. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and efficient removal spells.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, then use cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating combo. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask to prevent opponents from interfering with the reanimation plan. With the use of cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to consistently and efficiently execute its reanimation strategy to overwhelm and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping out high-cost creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand by utilizing cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. It also includes a suite of card draw and selection spells to help find combo pieces and disrupt opponents. The deck aims to cheat out these powerful creatures early in the game to overwhelm and overpower the opponent, leading to a swift victory. It also includes a strong suite of counterspells and protection to ensure the combo can be executed successfully.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and disruption, using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also leverages powerful card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing key cards. Additionally, the inclusion of Counterspell and Force of Will allows the deck to disrupt opponent's game plan while protecting its own threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and efficient control elements.

The deck focuses on generating large amounts of mana with cards like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while using Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures for additional mana. It includes powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Nissa, Vital Force to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith help to draw through the deck and find key pieces, while cards like Abrupt Decay and Sylvan Library provide additional utility and control options. The deck aims to assemble a large board state and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using low-cost, high-power creatures like Death's Shadow and Delver of Secrets to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Dismember and Fatal Push to deal with threats. By aggressively controlling the board and maintaining a strong presence, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and secure a victory before they have a chance to stabilize.
